cards.term: Compare traditional rice cultivation practices such as PDR (puddled rice transporting), and DRS (direct seeded rice).
cards.definition: Rice farming is heavily reliant on ready supplies of water and labour. Climate change and urbanisation, however, threaten traditional paddy cultivation. In many parts of Asia farmers are switching to direct seeded rice (DSR) as a more sustainable alternative. This is grown in dry fields, so uses less water and requires less work. It also cuts out the greenhouse gases that bacteria in paddy fields produce.
